intro: Drimia barteri, commonly known as the Natal lily, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its striking, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Drimia barteri has tuberous roots that store nutrients, allowing it to survive dry periods. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and floral arrangements.
